title: Lead Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Oct 2020
Interview Descriptions: I did a phone interview that asked general child care knowledge questions and learned about the center as a whole. I got introduced to the director and also the team coach when i came in for a in person interview that was more in depth and had different scenarios on a classroom setting.
Interview Questions: If a child were playing in the sink when they were supposed to, how do you handle this?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: You will have an individual interview and talk about what you have done and share your reaearch experiences. And you might ask questions like what kind of projecr you might be assigned, something like that..
Interview Questions: Tell me about your self and research experiences

title: Software Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the Software Engineer, received a mail after 1 week for the skype interview and then called me for the onsite interview . The interviewers are very friendly and make you comfortable during the process.
Interview Questions: Mostly about the previous projects and the challenges faced

title: DLC Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: Easy questions, nice interviewer, it was a quick process and Amy was super kind and sweet about everything. The interview was pretty easy, just basic questions that you could assume from any interviewer.
Interview Questions: When was a time you had a coworker you didn't agree with?

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer did not ask a very many  questions. It was mostly the PI describing the work they do in the lab. The  interviewer just confirmed the items on my resume and asked why I was interested in the job.
Interview Questions: What coursework have you taken that relates to this job?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Mar 2018
Interview Descriptions: There was a carousel interview where you had 5 short interviews with RAs and RDs. The questions are heavy on interpersonal relationships and potential floor events. You have to prepare a poster about yourself and you should spend a large amount of time preparing for presenting it.
Interview Questions: What are a few ways to be an effective communicator?

title: Staff Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal.  One on one.  Simple questions to determine if the candidate was a good fit for the position.  Also to see if the person's personality would be a good fit for the rest of the team.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a specific situation that involved multiple parties with one or more parties being hostile towards the others.

title: Post Doctoral Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying, was invited for a 40 mins Skype video call. The interviewer made me comfortable with the initial casual conversation . The interview questions were average . They called me by in two weeks from interview with the offer.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses.

title: Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The meeting only took about 15 minutes. Not all details of the job were explained correctly. Some of the information was misleading and not very professional. I felt I was judged more then being interviewed.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply for the position

title: Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was face to face with my supervisor and his supervisor. We met first in my supervisors office and then I went to meet his supervisor in his office.
Interview Questions: When can I start.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: It appears UNL has strict regulations on hiring process. I started off with a 30 minute phone interview, and then I got called for an in-person interview. I interviewed first with 5 people from the department and other departments (search committee). This was very formal. The final step was an interview with the boss, which was pleasant and informal.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with social media?

title: IT Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: One on one, basic procedures and about me. He talk about himself and ask what I know about information technology. We went through basic procedures and guidelines.  I also learned about the job during the interview.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: I actually didn't have an interview. the faculty decide about TA positrons based on availability. and that time they had vacancy so they hired me as a teaching assistant for undergrad students. I actually didn't have an interview. the faculty decide about TA positrons based on availability. and that time they had vacancy so they hired me as a teaching assistant for undergrad students.
Interview Questions: I actually didn't have an interview. the faculty decide about TA positrons based on availability. and that time they had vacancy so they hired me as a teaching assistant for undergrad students. I actually didn't have an interview. the faculty decide about TA positrons based on availability. and that time they had vacancy so they hired me as a teaching assistant for undergrad students.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Omaha, NE) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions: One Skype interview.  Did not take more than 15 minutes, I was asked to send my MS thesis and publications, there were some questions about background and experience with recycled aggregate. Also the willingness to work in the field.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to join this research team?

title: Senior Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Nebraska in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview was Cordial and professional. The interview lasted one hours. There was a committee on the line. They asked why I applied for the job and what I could offer.
Interview Questions: How could I contribute to the organization

title: Student Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a casual interview. Basic questions asked. They will also go through the rules and regulations of the NCAA. After the interview, you basically know f you got the job or not. You'll have to attend 2 more orientation thereafter (paid). However, you are already allowed to tutor an athlete after attending the first orientation session.
Interview Questions: How do you interact or overcome a problem when tutoring an international student?

title: Operations Lab Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Omaha, NE) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very easy and just had to be available and be there on time. Your flexibility with the schedule is very important for them to consider you. Very nice people and they accommodate you as much as possible
Interview Questions: Mostly about prior work experience and what you found useful

title: Research Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: it is 45 minutes presentation followed by interview by a panel of 4 people. Then a lab tour and lunch.  After interview, I waited about one month to hear back from the hire manager. Everything is smooth and it is a very typical interview process you can find.
Interview Questions:
Some Behavior questions and some Technical questions including:

How do you handle stress full situation
How do you deal with the conflication with you colleagues?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Nebraska in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is a 30 minutes talk about the software I used and my future plan about research. The professors have a particular project for the candidate to do. They asked me what kinds of classes I took. And what area I am interested most.
Interview Questions: They asked me 5 years plan of research work. I didn't prepare that question.

title: Library Services Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively laid back and quick. The supervisor was very amicable and made me feel comfortable. The overall process was mostly one interview and some other meetings with higher up people in the library system at UNL.
Interview Questions: How many hours of college courses are you taking? How many hours a week can you work?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: One-to-one conversation and presentation.
Interview Questions: Why choose a job in the university?

title: Special Events Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: Initially it started across email and I came in for 2 interviews.
Interview Questions: Name a time you have failed and what you did about it

title: Custodian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process for a custodian can be slow and long.  You will interview with at least two supervisors and probably a lead custodian as well.  It is a series of prewritten questions.  If they are interested you will get a second interview and as long as you pass the background check you will be hired.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be a custodian here.

title: Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: Pretty easy
Interview Questions: What was an experience you had working with diversity?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Nebraska
Interview Descriptions: Applied to graduate school and met the minimum requirements for entry.  Passed all my courses.
Interview Questions: No question asked

title: Campus Tour Guide Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Nov 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online to our campus work site, and was reached within the week to set up an interview.  I was offered the job on spot after about 10 minutes.  The worst part was getting cleared by HR.  The university's HR department is slow and inefficient.  They do not follow I-9 regulations properly and that can delay the process.  No e-verify.
Interview Questions: What do you know about the University?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Omaha, NE) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions:
1. Can you tell me a little about yourself?

This question seems simple, so many people fail to prepare for it, but it's crucial. Here's the deal: Don't give your complete employment (or personal) history. Instead give a pitch—one that’s concise and compelling and that shows exactly why you’re the right fit for the job. Start off with the 2-3 specific accomplishments or experiences that you most want the interviewer to know about, then wrap up talking about how that prior experience has positioned you for this specific role.
Interview Questions:
They asked a lot of question, but general, just google frequently asked questions, you can handle it.
Another seemingly innocuous interview question, this is actually a perfect opportunity to stand out and show your passion for and connection to the company. For example, if you found out about the gig through a friend or professional contact, name drop that person, then share why you were so excited about it. If you discovered the company through an event or article, share that. Even if you found the listing through a random job board, share what, specifically, caught your eye about the role.

title: Counter Service Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal. I sat down in an office with a manager and they just proceeded to ask me questions about my schedule and told me about job responsibilities.
Interview Questions: We require that you at least work one day of the weekend and you will have to work football games, is that going to be okay?

title: Managerial/Professional Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: The application process is easy & HR is great, but it's unfortunate when internal favoritism occurs during a public search, especially when the selected candidate doesn't meet preferred requirements.  I learned that candidate privacy isn't always taken into consideration & the process can be a big waste of time for interested, but non-favored candidates.  It sounds like this happens much more frequently than many care to admit.  It appeared that the search committee was much more concerned about completing the standardized HR questions than actually getting to know the skills/depth of potential candidates.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in May 2011
Interview Descriptions: I received a phone call and interviewed the next day. The interview was very easy.
Interview Questions: No unexpected questions. Very straight forward.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: I had a connection with the woman running the department for which I was going to work, so we had an informal conversation, I got into grad school, then we had a more formal interview.  I had previous experience in the industry and had worked on projects with the hiring person, so her instruction to me was to "get in" to grad school and it would like be a good fit.
Interview Questions: Is there any risk of you not getting into the program?

title: Editorial Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Lincoln, NE) in Oct 2010
Interview Descriptions: Worked as an intern. While there a full time position opened up. I interviewed for the position but was passed up. I continued my internship and a few months later they hired me without a subsequent interview
Interview Questions: Fairly straight-forward. They asked me about my experience. Since I was an intern they knew my skills and background fairly well. Nothing out of the ordinary.

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Nebraska (Omaha, NE) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: CV, Research goals, Recommendation letters, Teaching Philosophy, Areas of Specialization, Integration with core values. Informal face-to-face interview.
Interview Questions: N/A
